Package ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager

Class AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager.AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdasSignalCallback

    public abstract class AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdasSignalCallback
    A callback class pertaining to subscription of Advanced Driver Assistant System (ADAS) signal values of the boolean type.

    When calling an advanced method on an ADAS signal, you must create an AdasBooleanSubscribeCallback instance as an input parameter if the signal value is of the boolean type. This class provides two callback methods:

    • onChangeBooleanSignal: called when the Vehicle System Adapter (VSA) layer normally returns an ADAS signal value of the boolean type. This callback passes you the signal value.
    • onErrorBooleanSignal: called when the VSA layer fails to return an ADAS signal value of the boolean type. This callback passes you the error for you to determine how to handle it.
    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.ADAS

    • Method Detail

      • onChangeBooleanSignal

        public abstract void onChangeBooleanSignal​(boolean value)
        Called when the VSA layer normally returns an ADAS signal value of the boolean type.

        You must implement this callback for your application to perform a specific operation when the signal value changes.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the new signal value from the VSA layer.
        Since:
        5

      • onErrorBooleanSignal

        public abstract void onErrorBooleanSignal​()
        Called when the VSA layer fails to return an ADAS signal value of the boolean type.

        This callback passes you the error for you to determine how to handle it.

        Since:
        5

      • onChangeSignal

        public final void onChangeSignal​(AdasPropertyInfo propInfo)
        Description copied from interface: AdasSignalCallback
        Called when the VSA layer normally returns the specified ADAS signal value.

        This callback is invoked at the default interval of the specified ADAS signal value.

        Specified by:
        onChangeSignal in interface AdasSignalCallback
        Parameters:
        propInfo - Indicates ADAS signal information, including the ID, type, and value of the ADAS signal.

      • onErrorSignal

        public final void onErrorSignal​(java.lang.String propId,
                                int errorCode)
        Description copied from interface: AdasSignalCallback
        Called when the VSA layer fails to return the specified ADAS signal value.

        If the VSA layer fails to return the ADAS signal value, this callback is invoked to pass you the signal ID and error code for you to determine how to handle the error.

        Specified by:
        onErrorSignal in interface AdasSignalCallback
        Parameters:
        propId - Identifies the ADAS signal.
        errorCode - Indicates the error code of the failure to return the signal value. The value can be INVALID_ARGUMENT_ERR for a parameter error or ZVSHW_MANAGER_ERR for other errors.
